chargeHist.descr: Sex Offender Registration Violation - Out of State Offender

result.execSummary:
The defendant Yukio I. Will was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender Rigistration Violation - Out of State Offender, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(3)(a)1t.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If not living w/ mother of child, deft to pay child support.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
No violent cantact w/ Natasha B-V.  If not living w/ mother of child, deft to pay child support.  Comply w/ sex offender registry.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty John Caviale.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Yukio I. Will, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on December 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Yukio I. Will, appeared with Attorney John Louis Caviale.  Clerk: PT
Atty Caviale states he is no longer looking to withdraw; however, case is not resolved at this time.  15CF543 will trail this file.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:10 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Demand for Discovery filed by ADA Drees

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney John Louis Caviale appeared.  Clerk: PT
No appearance by the Defendant.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $3000 Cash Bond, but will stay it until Monday at which time bond will be forfeited if no voluntary appearance is requested.  

11:00 AM -  DE is now present in court.  Atty Cavaile states DE was confused with the date and was home with his sick kids.  Court vacates bench warrant and Atty Caviale requests a pre-trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
